Body: Standard Italian has 7 vocalic phonemes: a i u è é ò ó, some Northerners and most Southerners merge open and close e's and o's, but this is not a prestigious pronunciation (and it's strange-sounding to people from Emilia Romagna, Marche, Umbria, Rome or Tuscany). Nonetheless, you can find in many books for foreigners: ''Italian vowels are easy: ah, eh, eeh, oh, ooh.'' It's called dumbing down.
